text:
The client get’s a 502 bad gateway
and
Access to XMLHttpRequest at ‘…external server…’ from origin ‘…HubSpot domain…’ has been blocked by CORS policy: No ‘Access-Control-Allow-Origin’ header is present on the requested resource.

The first time I tested my api I got that message then I added the header `header("Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *");` to the server and it worked for me ever since. As the article explains the Headers are stripped by some firewalls <http://promincproductions.com/blog/server-proxy-for-cross-origin-resource-sharing-cors/>
So it looks like the clients firewall is doing this.

Hi <@UR8TW5WSU>, I am based in Dublin Ireland so we have some time difference in between us! I am glad HS has helped out in your time zone and yes there is the option to add on the property associatedcompanyid. Your GET request URL would look like this: <https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/recently_updated/contacts/recent?hapikey=DEMO&property=associatedcompanyid>
LMK if you have any further questions but it looks like you have all you need to progress right now :slightly_smiling_face:
